ext_description.p: A Functional_specification is the information that characterizes the behaviour of a under controlled circumstances using stimulus-response test methods. Detailed properties of the relationship between the reference and characterizing signals define the behaviour.
ext_description.note: The evaluation or categorization of this relationship is not standardized in this document.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the characteristic_category specifies the of the category for the Functional_specification.
the characterizing_signal specifies the response for the Functional_specification.
the characterizing_functional_unit specifies the for the Functional_specification.
the reference_signal specifies the reference or stimulus for the Functional_specification.
the associated_definition specifies the role of a for the Functional_specification. The associated_definition is an aggregation of all the Functional_specification with which it is associated.

A Signal_specification is a bounded behavioural characteristic as measured in a controlled environment.

ext_description.p: the characterization_network specifies the for this Signal_specification. In this part of ISO 10303, the characterization_network shall include all required simulated stimulus sources and measurement sensors.
ext_description.example: Examples of characterization_network types include test bench (VHDL), test fixture, test circuit.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the maximum_characteristic specifies the upper bound for the valid range of the for the Signal_specification.
the minimum_characteristic specifies the lower bound for the valid range of the for the Signal_specification.

ext_description.p: the reference_access_mechanism specifies the on the being characterized by this Signal_specification. The reference_access_mechanism need not be specified for a particular Signal_specification. The purpose of the reference_access_mechanism is to provide a reference facility for measurements. The reference_access_mechanism need not be provided.
ext_description.example: The reference_access_mechanism need not be supplied for evaluation of non-causal systems such as s- or z-plane characterized control system elements or digital elements. There is no assumption in this part of ISO 10303 that reference_access_mechanism is related to any standard reference node, for example, "0" in certain continuous system simulators. Example names of the terminal specified by reference_access_mechanism include Ground, Analogue ground, Digital ground, Trigger in, Gate out.

ext_description.note: The measurement_condition may specify data using text or graphics.
